intro: Cnidoscolus vitifolius, commonly known as the horse chestnut tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits that contain hard, chestnut-like seeds. It thrives in humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and parks in tropical regions.
